Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: We need to compare logs. Group A: Protected group, no community group, no score adjustment. Group B: Unprotected group, some have community group and get +10 boost. So bias is in favor of unprotected group with community membership. Also local resident attribute is true for all U cases but false for P cases; but that may not be relevant.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: We should explain bias: systematic difference in final decisions due to score adjustments based on community membership, leading to higher scores and approvals for U001 and U003 vs P001/P003 etc.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - IND
Text: Also mention that LocalResident being true might correlate with unprotected status? But the main bias is the CommunityGroup attribute leading to score adjustment.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: We should discuss how this leads to systematic differences: e.g., U001 gets +10 boost -> approved; P001 had 720 -> approved too but no boost; but if threshold was 725 maybe would be rejected. Similarly U003 gets boost from 695 to 705 -> approved; if threshold 700 maybe would be rejected otherwise.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Also note that the presence of a community group only occurs for unprotected individuals, giving them advantage.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Thus log B exhibits bias due to differential treatment based on protected status via community membership and score adjustments.
